document.title: Kansas Model Curricular Standards for Theatre

C9C696B0DFE50131C5FE68A86D17958E.description: records the connections made between all content areas and theatre when going through the production process of a self-scripted work.

C9C626F0DFE50131C5FD68A86D17958E.description: Integrates all the arts and other disciplines when taking a performance from page to stage.

C9C55600DFE50131C5FB68A86D17958E.description: interprets cultural, social, and political conditions that have influenced playwrights.

C9C4D6A0DFE50131C5FA68A86D17958E.description: researches and compares and contrasts historical production designs, techniques, and/or performances from various cultures.

C9C46D40DFE50131C5F968A86D17958E.description: explores how theatre reflects historical periods including how it is manifested today.

C9C412E0DFE50131C5F868A86D17958E.description: explores the major plays and playwrights throughout historical periods explaining the impact they have had on social development.

C9C3B660DFE50131C5F768A86D17958E.description: interprets the validity and practicality of cultural and historical information for making artistic choices in productions.

C9C357F0DFE50131C5F668A86D17958E.description: demonstrates how theatre has evolved from it's origins to today's modern theatre.

C9C2F0C0DFE50131C5F568A86D17958E.description: explains how dramatic texts reflect and reinforce cultural and historical contexts.

C9C27850DFE50131C5F468A86D17958E.description: Understands the role that theatre plays in cultures and history.

C9C20590DFE50131C5F368A86D17958E.description: dramatizes science concepts and themes through role playing.

C9C1A280DFE50131C5F268A86D17958E.description: identifies cultural patterns (social, religious, political, economic) as reflected in the theatre of the times.

C9C137D0DFE50131C5F168A86D17958E.description: demonstrates ways theatre and language arts work together to develop skills both in theatre and language arts.

C9C0D620DFE50131C5F068A86D17958E.description: explains how plays, movies, television, and live performances contribute to learning about culture.

C9C07C40DFE50131C5EF68A86D17958E.description: analyzes the way language arts enhance the expression of ideas and emotions in theatre.

C9C01F90DFE50131C5EE68A86D17958E.description: shows how theatre connects with math to enhance learning in each.

C9BFAA50DFE50131C5ED68A86D17958E.description: defines how the visual art's elements impact theatre in comparison to other are forms.

C9BF1CC0DFE50131C5EC68A86D17958E.description: analyzes how theatre connects with music to enhance performances and productions.

C9BEBE80DFE50131C5EB68A86D17958E.description: Understands the interrelationship that exists between theatre and other disciplines.

C9BE08D0DFE50131C5E968A86D17958E.description: applies ways the social sciences can assist in depicting a production based in a specific time period.

C9BDA7F0DFE50131C5E868A86D17958E.description: collaborates with Family and Consumer Sciences (FACS) students to design and construct costumes.

C9BD4080DFE50131C5E768A86D17958E.description: incorporates ways the industrial arts can assist in constructing flats for the theatre department following specific measurement and construction directions.

C9BCE110DFE50131C5E668A86D17958E.description: uses the visual arts to design and implement the set for a school performance.

C9BC8640DFE50131C5E568A86D17958E.description: makes connections between theatre and other fine arts by comparing and contrasting them.

C9BC2940DFE50131C5E468A86D17958E.description: Develops theatrical devices through the integration of other disciplines.

C9BB63C0DFE50131C5E268A86D17958E.description: develops settings through the use of visual art elements.

C9BAF800DFE50131C5E168A86D17958E.description: assists in selecting music and other sound appropriate for story dramatization.

C9BA8A90DFE50131C5E068A86D17958E.description: discusses how dance and creative movement are used in performances.

C9BA1660DFE50131C5DF68A86D17958E.description: lists characteristics specific to cultural settings.

C9B8DBD0DFE50131C5DC68A86D17958E.description: uses social issues to develop themes for scripts.

C9B876C0DFE50131C5DB68A86D17958E.description: identifies connections that exist between theatre and language arts.

C9B80540DFE50131C5DA68A86D17958E.description: Recognizes connections between theatre and other disciplines.

C9B749E0DFE50131C5D868A86D17958E.description: Integrating Theatre with other arts, disciplines, and the community

C9B6E800DFE50131C5D768A86D17958E.description: evaluates audiences response in relationship to actors' performance.

C9B687F0DFE50131C5D668A86D17958E.description: records evaluations of performances addressing its audience impact.

C9B61CA0DFE50131C5D568A86D17958E.description: analyzes and evaluates a variety of dramatic performances with positive, constructive criticism, and justifies responses.

C9B5B130DFE50131C5D468A86D17958E.description: Analyzes how criticism affects audience responses toward performances.

C9B545E0DFE50131C5D368A86D17958E.description: interpret cultural, social, and political conditions that have influenced playwrights.

C9B4E040DFE50131C5D268A86D17958E.description: explores how theatre reflects historical periods including how it is manifested today.

C9B46C90DFE50131C5D168A86D17958E.description: explores the major plays and playwrights throughout historical periods explaining the impact they have had on social development.

C9B3F1A0DFE50131C5D068A86D17958E.description: outlines ways their personal experiences of physical places have impacted and can affect their theatrical works.

C9B39070DFE50131C5CF68A86D17958E.description: documents and critiques present times from a theatrical perspective.

C9B32E50DFE50131C5CE68A86D17958E.description: describes and justifies personal artistic choices based on cultural interpretations.

C9B2C790DFE50131C5CD68A86D17958E.description: Explains the historical origins of various dramatic genres and theatrical forms and how historical contexts affect contemporary audience responses.

C9B26B40DFE50131C5CC68A86D17958E.description: defends personal meanings and interpretations of performances in light of critics' reviews.

C9B20B60DFE50131C5CB68A86D17958E.description: compares critics' evaluations with personal views.

C9B1A9E0DFE50131C5CA68A86D17958E.description: recognizes why critics' responses are different and at times similar to personal interpretations of works.

C9B143D0DFE50131C5C968A86D17958E.description: Compares critics' evaluations of performances with personal meanings and emotional responses.

C9B0D130DFE50131C5C868A86D17958E.description: explores emotional responses among different forms of theatrical performances.

C9B06770DFE50131C5C768A86D17958E.description: explores different stylistic approaches to sound, movement, and other spectacle elements.

C9B00240DFE50131C5C668A86D17958E.description: compares and contrasts performance's main ideas with your and others' real life situations.

C9AFA2D0DFE50131C5C568A86D17958E.description: compares and contrasts fully developed characterizations against stereotypes.

C9AF3D00DFE50131C5C468A86D17958E.description: compares linear and non-linear plot structures and how each communicates meaning.

C9AECAB0DFE50131C5C368A86D17958E.description: studies and compares professional criticism of same and different texts or performances.

C9AE4E00DFE50131C5C268A86D17958E.description: writes a thorough critical analysis of dramatic texts.

C9ADF120DFE50131C5C168A86D17958E.description: compares two different performances of the same script.

C9AD91D0DFE50131C5C068A86D17958E.description: Identifies the possible or actual intentions of respective theatre artists and justifies personal interpretations in comparison using aesthetic criteria.

C9ACC960DFE50131C5BE68A86D17958E.description: recognizes the distinctions in performances based on audience response.

C9AC6D50DFE50131C5BD68A86D17958E.description: compares two reviews of the same performance held for two different groups or audiences.

C9AC0F40DFE50131C5BC68A86D17958E.description: Analyzes how audience responses affect the criticism of performances.

C9ABA210DFE50131C5BB68A86D17958E.description: evaluates their own performances and that of others to determine the contextual accuracy regarding historical events and defends their conclusions.

C9AB2B90DFE50131C5BA68A86D17958E.description: develops criteria to be used in evaluating the contextual accuracy of their work and that of others.

C9AACCC0DFE50131C5B968A86D17958E.description: assesses the success of a performance's ability to depict a place or environment.

C9AA70C0DFE50131C5B868A86D17958E.description: examines the ability of a performance to accurately and/or successfully represent a given time period.

C9AA1290DFE50131C5B768A86D17958E.description: evaluates the cultural accuracy being revealed through performances.

C9A9ADE0DFE50131C5B668A86D17958E.description: explains the message being conveyed through a performance regarding the historical event being represented and/or addressed through it.

C9A94270DFE50131C5B568A86D17958E.description: Analyzes dramatic texts and performances to understand history, culture, times, and places in their respective contexts.

C9A8AEA0DFE50131C5B468A86D17958E.description: constructs social meaning from dramatic texts and relates these to current personal, national, and international issues.

C9A84810DFE50131C5B368A86D17958E.description: develops, articulates, justifies, and applies criteria for creating meaning in performances.

C9A7DD80DFE50131C5B268A86D17958E.description: analyzes and critiques a dramatic performance comparing perceived artistic intentions with final production achievement.

C9A771D0DFE50131C5B168A86D17958E.description: understands performances from the perspective of current personal, national, and international issues, through the evaluation of artistic choices in media.

C9A710B0DFE50131C5B068A86D17958E.description: analyzes and evaluates critical comments about personal work and explains which points are most appropriate to realize further developments of work.

C9A6A620DFE50131C5AF68A86D17958E.description: evaluates the artistic choices of self and the collaborative efforts of peers and suggests constructive alternatives.

C9A63770DFE50131C5AE68A86D17958E.description: Compares and contrasts social meanings and emotional responses to performances in theatre and electronic media.

C9A5C290DFE50131C5AD68A86D17958E.description: evaluates how well text/production met its intended objectives.

C9A56830DFE50131C5AC68A86D17958E.description: uses appropriate theatre vocabulary to evaluate the intentions, structures, effectiveness, and aesthetic values of performances.

C9A508E0DFE50131C5AB68A86D17958E.description: reads and analyzes dramatic literature in terms of structure, theme, character, imagery, symbolism, language, and style.

C9A4AB90DFE50131C5AA68A86D17958E.description: evaluates theatre's effectiveness in communicating ideas, meanings, and emotions.

C9A44BA0DFE50131C5A968A86D17958E.description: Uses aesthetic criteria to evaluate the artistic effectiveness of dramatic performances in theatre and electronic media.

C9A37950DFE50131C5A768A86D17958E.description: discusses how their own behavior impacted the performance.

C9A31730DFE50131C5A668A86D17958E.description: discusses the impact audience behaviors not experienced could have had on the performance if they were present.

C9A2B5F0DFE50131C5A568A86D17958E.description: attends and evaluates various performances to determine the impact audience behavior has on the work.

C9A24CB0DFE50131C5A468A86D17958E.description: Identifies how audiences' behavioral responses to actors performing live affect these performances.

C9A1DEB0DFE50131C5A368A86D17958E.description: describes how an historical event can lead to the development of a performance.

C9A18080DFE50131C5A268A86D17958E.description: compares and contrasts how works from different cultures and time periods convey the same or similar content or plot.

C9A12090DFE50131C5A168A86D17958E.description: explains how culture influences the content and meaning of theatrical works.

C9A0ADB0DFE50131C5A068A86D17958E.description: Explains how contextual aspects are impacted by various cultures, times, and places.

C9A04340DFE50131C59F68A86D17958E.description: explains why interpretations of meanings require a personal investment of mental effort.

C99FE3A0DFE50131C59E68A86D17958E.description: provides descriptions of and explanations for theatrical treatment of the same theme in different plays.

C99F82D0DFE50131C59D68A86D17958E.description: compares characters' situations in plays/performances with personal experiences.

C99F1F90DFE50131C59C68A86D17958E.description: explains how personal experiences affect one's interpretations of meanings in plays and performances.

C99EACE0DFE50131C59B68A86D17958E.description: Explains how and why personal meanings and emotional responses to performances apply to self and society.

C99E4450DFE50131C59A68A86D17958E.description: analyzes the causes and effects of central dramatic actions in dramatic texts.

C99DE030DFE50131C59968A86D17958E.description: identifies and explains allegorical and symbolic references in plays.

C99D8040DFE50131C59868A86D17958E.description: defends and justifies personal evaluations of one's own and others' performances.

C99D22A0DFE50131C59768A86D17958E.description: evaluates the effectiveness of artistic choices made by respective theatre artists.

C99CBA70DFE50131C59668A86D17958E.description: develops and applies criteria to evaluating dramatic elements in plays and performances.

C99C5F80DFE50131C59568A86D17958E.description: Analyzes and evaluates the dramatic elements that work and why, in performances and electronic media.

C99B9D10DFE50131C59368A86D17958E.description: understands why cell phones and beeping pagers/watches disturb actors and other audience members.

C99B3820DFE50131C59268A86D17958E.description: explains why cameras and other recording devices are prohibited by copyright law.

C99AD600DFE50131C59168A86D17958E.description: discusses behaviors that would interrupt the performance.

C99A76C0DFE50131C59068A86D17958E.description: explains appropriate and inappropriate emotional behavior.

C99A0CB0DFE50131C58F68A86D17958E.description: orally explains the dos and don'ts regarding appropriate audience dress.

C99981A0DFE50131C58E68A86D17958E.description: watches, listens to, and responds mindfully and emotionally to theatre events.

C998F2A0DFE50131C58D68A86D17958E.description: invests sufficient mental effort during performances to make meanings.

C9988AE0DFE50131C58C68A86D17958E.description: discusses performances with peers after attending.

C9980EF0DFE50131C58B68A86D17958E.description: expresses emotions when attending public performances with live or recorded actors.

C9972460DFE50131C58968A86D17958E.description: describes dramatic elements in plays and performances that indicate particular qualities related to cultures, times, and places.

C996C7C0DFE50131C58868A86D17958E.description: compares and contrasts the theatrical treatment of fictional stories with actual life events in the past and present.

C99668C0DFE50131C58768A86D17958E.description: compares and contrasts the similarities and differences between dramatic fiction and factual stories.

C9960370DFE50131C58668A86D17958E.description: recognizes how theatre communicates ideas about past and present culture and social context.

C9959A60DFE50131C58568A86D17958E.description: Recognizes the contextual aspects of performances from various cultures, times, and places.

C99537F0DFE50131C58468A86D17958E.description: recognizes the similarities and differences between staged performances and real life events.

C994CBE0DFE50131C58368A86D17958E.description: compares personal interpretations of plays with respective performances.

C9946110DFE50131C58268A86D17958E.description: examines how and why individuals respond differently to the same performance.

C993F680DFE50131C58168A86D17958E.description: explains how main ideas relate to self and society.

C9938C60DFE50131C58068A86D17958E.description: articulates and discusses emotional reactions to the whole, as well as parts of theatricalexperiences and identifies the dramatic elements that impacted these emotions.

C9933180DFE50131C57F68A86D17958E.description: describes personal meanings and main ideas (themes, messages) interpreted from dramatized stories and performances.

C992D340DFE50131C57E68A86D17958E.description: Identifies and reflects upon personal meaning and emotional responses to performances and applies ideas to self and society.

C9926EF0DFE50131C57D68A86D17958E.description: classifies basic dramatic genres (comic, serious drama) and theatrical forms (realistic and non-realistic).

C9920C10DFE50131C57C68A86D17958E.description: explains reasons for personal aesthetic preferences based on dramatic elements used.

C991A1C0DFE50131C57B68A86D17958E.description: identifies the dramatic elements that make their own and others performances successful or unsuccessful. Explain why.

C99140B0DFE50131C57A68A86D17958E.description: identifies dramatic elements in live and recorded theatrical performances (movement dialogue, scenery, costumes, etc) and how they combine to communicate ideas and evoke emotions.

C990E1C0DFE50131C57968A86D17958E.description: gives and explains personal opinions about a play's message and the impact of the dramatic content on its performance.

C9908100DFE50131C57868A86D17958E.description: defines and uses theatrical terms/vocabulary when discussing dramatic content (plot, characters, themes, etc) and theatrical forms (realistic and non-realistic).

C99020E0DFE50131C57768A86D17958E.description: Identifies how dramatic elements communicate meanings and elicit emotions in stories, performances, and electronic media.

C98F4190DFE50131C57568A86D17958E.description: Evaluating and Reflecting on the Characteristics and Merits of Dramatic Content and Theatrical Forms in their Work and that of Others

C98ED6B0DFE50131C57468A86D17958E.description: advertises their production through the media (TV, Radio, Newspaper).

C98E7660DFE50131C57368A86D17958E.description: creates and implements production schedules, stage management plans, promotional campaigns. And business and front of house procedures.

C98E1970DFE50131C57268A86D17958E.description: Creates and implements marketing plans for a selfscripted production.

C98DB2D0DFE50131C57168A86D17958E.description: rewrites a script, designs it, and creates a unified set for a production.

C98D5170DFE50131C57068A86D17958E.description: Completes a set for a production.

C98CEA50DFE50131C56F68A86D17958E.description: researches historical context of a script and uses the findings as a basis for interpretation and design.

C98C8660DFE50131C56E68A86D17958E.description: conceptualizes and provides artistic interpretations for informal or formal productions.

C98BBC10DFE50131C56C68A86D17958E.description: communicates with other crew members and among those fulfilling the other theatre staff roles.

C98B5E10DFE50131C56B68A86D17958E.description: explains the interaction that occurs across the various roles.

C98AFD10DFE50131C56A68A86D17958E.description: fulfills the responsibilities of the designers, technicians, and creators.

C98A9190DFE50131C56968A86D17958E.description: fulfills the responsibilities of a crew chief for an actual production.

C98A2540DFE50131C56868A86D17958E.description: collaborates with directors and other designers.

C989A0B0DFE50131C56768A86D17958E.description: plans prop list, costumes, floor plans, and lighting plot.

C9894170DFE50131C56668A86D17958E.description: Fulfills the roles and responsibilities as a unified unit necessary for a successful production.

C98888A0DFE50131C56468A86D17958E.description: completes an application for production rights.

C9882460DFE50131C56368A86D17958E.description: creates a production management chart and timeline (rehearsal schedule or production calendar).

C987C0B0DFE50131C56268A86D17958E.description: designs and implements coherent promotional and business plans.

C9876050DFE50131C56168A86D17958E.description: Fulfills various roles of a marketing staff.

C986FD20DFE50131C56068A86D17958E.description: performs safe use of stage tools and equipment.

C986A0A0DFE50131C55F68A86D17958E.description: explains reasons for using safe techniques in crafting a staged performance.

C9863F10DFE50131C55E68A86D17958E.description: Implements safe use of stage tools and equipment.

C985D6B0DFE50131C55D68A86D17958E.description: recognizes costumes and scenery from different historical periods and applies qualities to costume design.

C9857560DFE50131C55C68A86D17958E.description: practices basic makeup techniques by applying makeup.

C98519A0DFE50131C55B68A86D17958E.description: assists in effectively creating and collecting the functional scenery, properties, lighting, sound, costumes, and makeup needed for a production.

C984B940DFE50131C55A68A86D17958E.description: Creates accessories for a self-designed script.

C9845820DFE50131C55968A86D17958E.description: lists and describes effective methods for developing a floor plan for a stage setting.

C983EBE0DFE50131C55868A86D17958E.description: develops designs that use visual and aural elements to convey environment (e.g. place, time, atmosphere/mood) and clearly support the text.

C9838AE0DFE50131C55768A86D17958E.description: creates a make-up plan for the characters of a play.

C98326C0DFE50131C55668A86D17958E.description: makes a list of costumes and one of props needed for a production and determines possible sources.

C982BA10DFE50131C55568A86D17958E.description: organizes set building by listing jobs, equipment, and personnel needed for a production.

C9824CB0DFE50131C55468A86D17958E.description: explains how the technical requirements of a given script relate to and support one another.

C981D7C0DFE50131C55368A86D17958E.description: creates technical plots, plans, and worksheets for a script or production.

C9813C90DFE50131C55268A86D17958E.description: Designs a technical plan for scripted scenes.

C980D600DFE50131C55168A86D17958E.description: explains the importance of communication among theatre staff.

C98074A0DFE50131C55068A86D17958E.description: explains the importance of the responsibilities associated with each of the above roles.

C9800DF0DFE50131C54F68A86D17958E.description: describes the responsibilities of each of the following roles: production designer, director, production crew, stage manager.

C97FB0C0DFE50131C54E68A86D17958E.description: Defines the roles and responsibilities of a production staff.

C97EF6C0DFE50131C54C68A86D17958E.description: designs and presents newspaper and radio advertisements for a production.

C97E92B0DFE50131C54B68A86D17958E.description: designs various marketing products for a production.

C97E2330DFE50131C54A68A86D17958E.description: creates posters, programs, and other marketing materials for a production.

C97DBB40DFE50131C54968A86D17958E.description: identifies the qualities needed in advertising materials for marketing a play.

C97D5240DFE50131C54868A86D17958E.description: identifies marketing materials needed for advertising a play.

C97CEBE0DFE50131C54768A86D17958E.description: Knows how to design advertising and marketing materials.

C97C8470DFE50131C54668A86D17958E.description: identifies the basic parts of a theatre including down stage, up stage, front of house, and others.

C97C2370DFE50131C54568A86D17958E.description: describes the basic parts of a theatre and their function.

C97BA610DFE50131C54468A86D17958E.description: names the basic parts of a theatre.

C97B2280DFE50131C54368A86D17958E.description: Knows the basic parts of a theatre facility.

C97ABAC0DFE50131C54268A86D17958E.description: studies facial features of a character and practices basic makeup techniques by applying make-up.

C97A5340DFE50131C54168A86D17958E.description: selects objects needed for physical setting of a production.

C979E4A0DFE50131C54068A86D17958E.description: selects sound and lighting appropriate for a production.

C97981E0DFE50131C53F68A86D17958E.description: collects costumes needed for a production.

C97917D0DFE50131C53E68A86D17958E.description: makes and collects props for a play production.

C9784020DFE50131C53C68A86D17958E.description: Creates accessories needed for classroom plays and staged productions.

C977C210DFE50131C53B68A86D17958E.description: orally defends reasons and purpose for scene design setting.

C97747D0DFE50131C53A68A86D17958E.description: effectively edits and presents a final set for a select scene.

C976EB10DFE50131C53968A86D17958E.description: effectively sketches a set for a select scene.

C9768870DFE50131C53868A86D17958E.description: effectively coordinates elements of art to create a setting.

C97622C0DFE50131C53768A86D17958E.description: knows how to visualize settings appropriate to a script.

C9755CA0DFE50131C53568A86D17958E.description: explains the importance of each role to the success of the production.

C974FB60DFE50131C53468A86D17958E.description: lists orally or in written format the basic roles associated with theatre production.

C9734AF0DFE50131C53068A86D17958E.description: identifies the qualities needed in advertising materials for marketing a play.

C97271D0DFE50131C52E68A86D17958E.description: Knows how to design simple advertising and marketing materials.
